lib_basgra module¶

lib_basgra.allocation(glvsi, gstsi, daylge, allotot, gressi, yg)¶

Allocation

Parameters

  • glvsi – Potential growth rate of leaf mass (g C/m2/day)

  • gstsi – Potential growth rate of stems (g C/m2/day)

  • daylge – Day length effect on allocation, tillering, leaf appearance, leaf elongation (-)

  • allotot – Allocation of carbohydrates to sinks other than hardening (g C/m2/day)

  • gressi – Sink strength of reserve pool (g C/m2/day)

  • yg – Growth yield per unit expended carbohydrate (g C/G C)

Result gres

Gross growth rate of reserve pool, uncorrected for remobilisation (g C/m2/day)

Result glv

Growth of leaf mass (g C/m2/day)

Result gst

Growth of stems (g C/m2/day)

Result grt

Growth of roots (g C/m2/day)

Result respgsh

Respiration associated with shoot growth (g C/m2/day)

Result respgrt

Respiration associated with root growth (g C/m2/day)

lib_basgra.anaerobicdamage(permgas, tanaer, delt, ldt50a, ldt50b, lt50, krdranaer)¶

Anaerobic Damage

Parameters

  • permgas – Permeability of soil surface to gas exchange (-/day)

  • tanaer – Time since start anaerobic conditions (d)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • ldt50a – Intercept of linear dependence of LD50 on lT50 (day)

  • ldt50b – Slope of linear dependence of LD50 on LT50 (day/C)

  • lt50 – Sensitivity to Frost (Lethal Temperature 50%) Temperature that kills half the plants in a day (C)

  • krdranaer – Maximum relative death rate due to anearobic conditions (-/day)

Result dtanaer

Change in days since start anaerobic conditions (day/day)

Result rdrtox

Relative death rate due to anaerobic conditions (day/day)

lib_basgra.biomass(cocresmx, clv, cres, cst)¶

Biomass

Parameters

  • cocresmx – Maximum concentration of reserves in aboveground biomass (not stubble) (-)

  • clv – Carbon in leaves (g C / m2)

  • cres – Carbon in reserves (g C / m2)

  • cst – Carbon in stems (g C / m2)

Result cresmx

Maximum amount of reserves (g C / m2)

Result resnor

Normalised concentration of reserves (-)

lib_basgra.ddayl(doy, lat)¶

Compute day length

Author

marcel van oijen (ceh-edinburgh)

Description

Calculate day length (d d-1) from julian day and latitude (lat, degn)

:param doy Day Of Year (1-366) :param lat Latitude (degrees) :result dayl Day length (d/d)

lib_basgra.evaptrtrf(fdepth, rootd, wal, wcad, pevap, wcfc, wcwp, ptran, tranco, wcst, wcwet, delt)¶

Evaporation, Transpiration & Transpiration Fraction

Parameters

  • fdepth – Soil frost layer depth (m)

  • rootd – Rooting depth (m)

  • wal – Soil water amount, liquid (mm)

  • wcad – Water concentration at air dryness (m3/m3)

  • pevap – Potential rate of evaporation from the soil (mm/day)

  • wcfc – Water concentration at field capacity (m3/m3)

  • wcwp – Water concentration at wilting point (m3/m3)

  • ptran – Potential transpiration rate (mm/day)

  • tranco – Transpiration coefficient (mm/day)

  • wcst – Water concentration at saturation (m3/m3)

  • wcwet – Water concentration above which transpiration is reduced (m3/m3)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

Result evap

Evaporation of water from soil surface (mm/day)

Result tran

Transpiration of water from soil surface (mm/day)

Result tranrf

Transpiration realisation factor (-)

lib_basgra.foliage1(tbase, davtmp, daylge, slamax, fslamin, resnor)¶

Foliage 1

Parameters

  • tbase – Minimum value of effective temperature for leaf elongation (C)

  • davtmp – Daily average temperature (Celsius)

  • daylge – Day length effect on allocation, tillering, leaf appearance, leaf elongation (-)

  • slamax – Maximum SLA of new leaves (m2 leaf g / C)

  • fslamin – Minimum SLA of new leaves as a fraction of maximum possible SLA (-)

  • resnor – Normalised concentration of reserves (-)

Result efftmp

Effective temperature for leaf elongation (C)

Result lerv

Elongation rate of leaves on non-elongating tillers (m/day)

Result lerg

Elongation rate of leaves on elongating tillers (m/day)

Result slamin

Minimum SLA of new leaves (= SLAMAX * FSLAMIN) (m2 leaf / g C)

Result slanew

SLA of new leaf (m2 leaf / g C)

lib_basgra.foliage2(slanew, glv, tsurf, tbase, phy, noharv, tranrf, daylge, fractv, phenrf, laitil, laieft, lai, fsmax, resnor, tilv, davtmp, toptge, tv2til, rgenmx, vern, dayl, daylg1g2, tilg1, rgrtg1g2)¶

Foliage 2

Parameters

  • slanew – SLA of new leaf (m2 leaf g/C-)

  • glv – Growth rate of leaf mass (g C/m2/day)

  • tsurf – Soil surface temperature (C)

  • tbase – Minimum value of effective temperature for leaf elongation (C)

  • phy – Phyllochron (C day)

  • noharv – Flag indicating that the current day is not a harvest day (-)

  • tranrf – Transpiration realisation factor (-)

  • daylge – Day length effect on allocation, tillering, leaf appearance, leaf elongation (-)

  • fractv – Fraction of tillers that is not elongating (-)

  • phenrf – Effect of phenological stage on leaf elongation and appearance in elongating tillers (-)

  • laitil – Maximum ratio of tiller and leaf apearance at low leaf area index (-)

  • laieft – Decrease in tillering with leaf area index (m2/m2 leaf)

  • lai – Leaf Area Index (m2 leaf / m2)

  • fsmax – Maximum ratio of tiller and leaf appearance based on sward geometry (-)

  • resnor – Normalised concentration of reserves (-)

  • tilv – Non-elongating tiller density (-/m2)

  • davtmp – Daily average temperature (Celsius)

  • toptge – Optimum temperature for vegetative tillers becoming generative (C)

  • tv2til – Relative death rate of non-elongating tillers (-/day)

  • rgenmx – Maximum relative rate of tillers becoming elongating tillers (-/day)

  • vern – Vernalization status (-)

  • dayl – Day length (day/day)

  • daylg1g2 – Minimum day length above which generative tillers can start elongating (by moving from TILG1 to TILG2). (day/day)

  • tilg1 – Non-elongating generative tiller density (-/m2)

  • rgrtg1g2 – Relative rate of TILG1 becoming TILG2 (tiller/tiller/day)

Result glai

Growth rate of leaf area (m2 leaf /m2/day)

Result gtilv

Growth of non-elongating tillers (g C/m2/day)

Result tilvg1

Number of non-elongating tillers (tillers)

Result tilg1g2

Number of Non-elongating generative tiller becoming elongating generative tillers (tillers)

lib_basgra.frdrunir(wcfc, rootd, fdepth, wcst, infil, pooldrain, wal, delt, evap, tran, frate, was, drate, irrigf)¶

Freezing, Thawing, Draining, Runoff, Irrigation

Parameters

  • wcfc – Water concentration at field capacity (m3/m3)

  • rootd – Rooting depth (m)

  • fdepth – Soil frost layer depth (m)

  • wcst – Water concentration at saturation (m3/m3)

  • infil – Water flow into soil from precipitation and snow melt (mm/day)

  • pooldrain – Water flow from pool to soil (mm/day)

  • wal – Soil water amount, liquid (mm)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • evap – Evaporation of water from soil surface (mm/day)

  • tran – Transpiration of water from soil surface (mm/day)

  • frate – Rate of increase of frost layer depth (m/day)

  • was – Soil water amount: solid (=ice) (mm)

  • drate – Maximum drainage rate (mm/day)

  • irrigf – Irrigation relative to what would maintain field capacity (-)

Result freezel

Freezing of soil water (mm/day)

Result thaws

Water flow to soil pool from thawing of frozen soil (mm/day)

Result drain

Drainage rate below the root zone (mm/day)

Result runoff

Loss of water by runoff (mm/day)

Result irrig

Irrigation rate (mm/day)

lib_basgra.frozensoil(fdepth, rootd, wcfc, was, wcl, tsurf, lambdasoil, rhowater, latentheat, delt)¶

Frozen Soil Variation

Parameters

  • fdepth – Soil frost layer depth (m)

  • rootd – Rooting depth (m)

  • wcfc – Water concentration at field capacity (m3/m3)

  • was – Soil water amount, solid (=ice) (mm)

  • wcl – Water concentration in non-frozen soil (m3/m3)

  • tsurf – Soil surface temperature (C)

  • lambdasoil – Soil parameter (J/m/C/day)

  • rhowater – Density of water (kg/m3)

  • latentheat – Latent heat of water fusion (J/kg)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

Result fsv

Frozem Soil variation

lib_basgra.growth(parint, tranrf, luemxq, noharv, cres, tcres, davtmp, resphardsi, cresmx, delt, tilg2, cst, cstavm, simax1t, phenrf, nellvm, lerv, tilv, lfwidv, lerg, lfwidg, shape, slanew, yg, daylge)¶

Growth

Parameters

  • parint – PAR interception (mol PAR /m2/day)

  • tranrf – Transpiration realisation factor (-)

  • luemxq – Light-use efficiency (mol CO2/mol PAR)

  • noharv – Flag indicating that the current day is not a harvest day (-)

  • cres – Carbon in reserves (g C/m2)

  • tcres – Time constant of mobilisation of reserves (day)

  • davtmp – Daily average temperature (Celsius)

  • resphardsi – Sink strength from carbohydrate demand of hardening (g C/m2/day)

  • cresmx – Maximum amount of reserves (g C/m2)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • tilg2 – Elongating generative tiller density (-/m2)

  • cst – Weight of stems (g C/m2)

  • cstavm – Maximum size of elongating tillers (g C/tiller)

  • simax1t – Sink strength of small elongating tillers (g C/tiller)

  • phenrf – Effect of phenological stage on leaf elongation and appearance in elongating tillers (-)

  • nellvm – Number of elongating leaves per non-elongating tiller (-/tiller)

  • lerv – Elongation rate of leaves on non-elongating tillers (m/day)

  • tilv – Non-elongating tiller density (-/m2)

  • lfwidv – Leaf width on non-elongating tillers (m)

  • lerg – Elongation rate of leaves on elongating tillers (m/day)

  • lfwidg – Leaf width on elongating tillers (m)

  • shape – Area of a leaf relative to a rectangle of same length and width (-)

  • slanew – SLA of new leaf (m2 leaf g/C-)

  • yg – Growth yield per unit expended carbohydrate (g C / g C)

  • daylge – Day length effect on allocation, tillering, leaf appearance, leaf elongation (-)

Result resmob

Mobilisation of reserves (g C/m2/day)

Result resphard

Plant hardening respiration (g C/m2/day)

Result gres

Gross growth rate of reserve pool, uncorrected for remobilisation (g C/m2/day)

Result glv

Growth of leaf mass (g C/m2/day)

Result gst

Growth of stems (g C/m2/day)

Result grt

Growth of roots (g C/m2/day)

Result respgsh

Respiration associated with shoot growth (g C/m2/day)

Result respgrt

Respiration associated with root growth (g C/m2/day)

lib_basgra.hardening(krsr3h, tsurf, lt50, dparam, lt50mx, tsurfdiff, delt, ratedmx, resphard, clv, kresphard)¶

Hardening

Parameters

  • krsr3h – Constant in the logistic curve for frost survival (-/C)

  • tsurf – Soil surface temperature (C)

  • lt50 – Sensitivity to Frost (Lethal Temperature 50%) Temperature that kills half the plants in a day (C)

  • dparam – Constant in the calculation of dehardening rate (-/C/day)

  • lt50mx – Maximum LT50 (C)

  • tsurfdiff – Soil surface temperature (C)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • ratedmx – Maximum dehardening rate (C/day)

  • resphard – Plant hardening respiration (g C/m2/day)

  • clv – Carbon in leaves (g C/m2)

  • kresphard – Carbohydrate requirement of hardening (g C/ g C /C)

Result rdrfrost

Relative death rate due to frost (-/day)

Result hardrate

Hardening (LT50 becoming more negative) (C/day)

Result dehardrate

Dehardening rate (LT50 becoming less negative) (C/day)

lib_basgra.hardeningsink(rehardredend, rehardredday, doy, tsurf, thardmx, lt50, lt50mn, hparam, clv, kresphard, resnor)¶
lib_basgra.harvest(rsgcut, tilv, tilg2, claiv, lai, delt, clv, phen, hagere, cres, cst)¶

Harvest

Parameters

  • rsgcut – RS-based observation of grass cut (harvest)

  • tilv – Non-elongating tiller density (-/m2)

  • tilg2 – Elongating generative tiller density (-/m2)

  • claiv – Maximum LAI remaining after harvest, when no tillers elongate (m2 leaf / m2)

  • lai – Leaf area index (m2 leaf / m2)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • clv – Carbon in leaves (g C/m2)

  • phen – Phenological stage (-)

  • hagere – Fraction of reserves in elongating tillers that is harvested (-)

  • cres – Carbon in reserves (g C/m2)

  • cst – Carbon in stems (g C/m2)

Result harv

Flag indicating that the current day is a harvest day (-)

Result noharv

Flag indicating that the current day is not a harvest day (-)

Result fractv

Fraction of tillers that is not elongating (-)

Result harvla

Harvested leaf area (m2 leaf / m2/day)

Result harvlv

Harvested leaf mass (g C/m2/day)

Result harvph

Resetting of phenological stage by harvesting (-/day)

Result harvre

Harvested reserves (g C/m2/day)

Result harvst

Harvested stem mass (g C/m2/day)

Result gstub

Growth of stubble due to harvest of elongating tillers (g C/m2/day)

Result harvtilg2

Number of elongating generative tillers harvested today (tiller/day)

lib_basgra.infilrunon(fdepth, poolinfillimit, pinfil)¶

Infiltration Run-On

Parameters

  • fdepth – Soil frost layer depth (m)

  • poolinfillimit – Soil frost depth limit for water infiltration (m)

  • pinfil – Infil of Pool (Wsupply - RNINTC) (mm/day)

Result runon

Water in excess of what can infiltrate the soil (mm/day)

lib_basgra.light(dayl, par, k, lai, dtr)¶

Light

Parameters

  • dayl – Day Length (day/day)

  • par – Daily photosynthetically active radiation (mol PAR/m2/day)

  • k – PAR extinction coefficient (m2 / m2 leaf)

  • lai – Leaf Area index (m2 leaf / m2)

  • dtr – Daily global radiation (MJ GR/m2/day)

Result parav

Average PAR during the photoperiod (mumol PAR /m2/s) (micromol par quanta m-2 s-)

Result parint

PAR interception (mol PAR /m2/day)

Result dtrint

Interception of global radiation (MJ GR/m2/day)

lib_basgra.liquidwaterdistribution(staywet, snowmelt, pwater, wavail, wmaxstore)¶

Liquid Water Distribution

Parameters

  • staywet – Liquid water in snow remaining liquid (mm/day)

  • snowmelt – Snow melting (mm/day)

  • pwater – Potential water vailable from rain (mm/day)

  • wavail – Liquid water from rain, snow melt and storage in snow (mm/day)

  • wmaxstore – Liquid water storage capacity of the snowpack (mm/day)

Result wavail

Liquid water from rain, snow melt and storage in snow (mm/day)

Result wremain

Liquid water staying in snow pack (mm/day)

Result wsupply

Liquid water not staying in snow pack (mm/day)

lib_basgra.lueco2tm(davtmp, rubisc, co2a, kluetilg, fractv, k, parav)¶

Calculate luemxq (mol co2 mol-1 par quanta)

Parameters

  • davtmp – Daily average temperature (Celsius)

  • rubisc – Rubisco content of upper leaves (g/m2 leaf)

  • co2a – CO2 concentration in atmosphere (ppm)

  • kluetilg – LUE-increase with increasing fraction elongating tillers (-)

  • fractv – Fraction of tillers that is not elongating (-)

  • k – PAR extinction coefficient (m2 / m2 leaf)

  • parav – Average PAR during the photoperiod (mumol PAR /m2/s) (micromol par quanta m-2 s-)

Result rehardredstart

Result resphardsi

lib_basgra.o2fluxes(fo2mx, rootd, fgas, rplantaer, krtotaer, permgas, o2, delt)¶

O2 Fluxes

Parameters

  • fo2mx – Maximum oxygen fraction of soil gas (mol O2/mol gas)

  • rootd – Rooting depth (m)

  • fgas – Soil pore space (potentially gaseous) (m3/m3)

  • rplantaer – Aerobic plant respiration (g C/m2/day)

  • krtotaer – Ratio of total to aerobic respiration (-)

  • permgas – Permeability of soil surface to gas exchange (-/day)

  • o2 – Soil oxygen content (mol/m2)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

Result o2mx

Maximum oxygen content of soil (mol/m2)

Result o2out

Efflux of oxygen from the soil (mol/m2/day)

Result o2in

Influx of oxygen into the soil (mol/m2/day)

lib_basgra.o2status(o2, rootd, fgas)¶

O2 Status

Parameters

  • o2 – Soil oxygen content (mol/m2)

  • rootd – Rooting depth (m)

  • fgas – Soil pore space (potentially gaseous) (m3/m3)

Result O2

Status

lib_basgra.penman(dtr, davtmp, wn, vp, lai, rnintc)¶

Calculate potential rates of evaporation and transpiration (mm d-1)

Author

marcel van oijen (ceh-edinburgh)

Description

Compute Penman and split E and T

inputs = lai (m2 m-2), dtr (mj gr m-2 d-1), rnintc (mm d-1) inputs not in header = vp (kpa), wn (m s-1) outputs = pevap & ptran (mm d-1)

Parameters

  • dtr – Daily global radiation (MJ GR/m2/day)

  • davtmp – Daily average temperature (Celsius)

  • wn – Windspeed (m/s)

  • vp – Vapour Pressure (kPa)

  • lai – Leaf Area Index (m2 leaf /m2)

  • rnintc – Interception of precipitation by the canopy (mm/day)

Result pevap

Potential rate of evaporation from the soil (mm/day)

Result ptran

Potential transpiration rate (mm/day)

lib_basgra.phenology(davtmp, daylp, dayl, daylb, phen, delt, phencr, dlmxge)¶

Phenology

Parameters

  • davtmp – Daily average temperature (Celsius)

  • daylp – Day length below which phenological development slows down (d/d)

  • dayl – Day length (d/d)

  • daylb – Day length below which phenological stage is reset to zero (d/d)

  • phen – Phenological stage (-)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • phencr – Phenological stage above which elongation and appearance of leaves on elongating tillers decreases (-)

  • dlmxge – Day length below which DAYLGE becomes less than 1 (d/d)

Result gphen

Rate of phenological development (-/day)

Result dphen

Rate of decrease of phenological stage (-/day)

Result phenrf

Effect of phenological stage on leaf elongation and appearance in elongating tillers (-)

Result daylge

Day length effect on allocation, tillering, leaf appearance, leaf elongation (-)

lib_basgra.physics(davtmp, fdepth, rootd, sdepth, was, gamma, wcl, delt, wcfc, tsurf, lambdasoil, rhowater, latentheat)¶

Physics update

Parameters

  • davtmp – Daily average temperature (Celsius)

  • fdepth – Soil frost layer depth (m)

  • rootd – Rooting depth (m)

  • sdepth – Snow depth (m)

  • was – Soil water amount, solid (=ice) (mm)

  • gamma – Temperature extinction coefficient of snow (-/m)

  • wcl – Water concentration in non-frozen soil (m3/m3)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • wcfc – Water concentration at field capacity (m3/m3)

  • tsurf – Soil surface temperature (C)

  • lambdasoil – Soil parameter (J/m/C/day)

  • rhowater – Density of water (kg/m3)

  • latentheat – Latent heat of water fusion (J/kg)

Result tsurf

Soil surface temperature (C)

Result fperm

Flag for full soil depth Freezing (0/1)

Result frate

Rate of increase of frost layer depth (m/day)

lib_basgra.plantrespiration(fo2, fo2mx, respgrt, respgsh, resphard)¶

Plant Respiration

Parameters

  • fo2 – Soil oxygen as a fraction of total gas (mol O2/mol gas)

  • fo2mx – Maximum oxygen fraction of soil gas (mol O2/mol gas)

  • respgrt – Respiration associated with root growth (g C/m2/day)

  • respgsh – Respiration associated with shoot growth (g C/m2/day)

  • resphard – Plant hardening respiration (g C/m2/day)

Result rplantaer

Aerobic plant respiration (g C/m2/day)

lib_basgra.precform(davtmp, trainsnow, rain)¶

Partition rainfall volume into either potential water or potential snow depending on temperature

Parameters

  • davtmp – Daily average temperature (Celsius)

  • trainsnow – Temperature below which precipitation is snow (Celsius)

  • rain – Rainfall (mm/day)

Result pwater

Potential water available from rain (mm/day)

Result psnow

Potential snow available from rain (mm/day)

lib_basgra.rainsnowsurfacepool(davtmp, trainsnow, rain, bias, ampl, freq, doy, tmeltfreeze, melt, swret, swrf, drystor, snowmelt, wetstor, refreeze, pwater, wavail, sdepth, delt, rhopack, lai, fdepth, poolinfillimit, pinfil, wpoolmax, wapl, waps, runon, poolvolremain, poolinfil, frate, tsurf, lambdaice, rhowater, latentheat, eta, freezepl, infil, packmelt, pooldrain, thawps, wremain)¶

Rain Snow Surface Pool

Parameters

  • davtmp – Daily average temperature (Celsius)

  • trainsnow – Temperature below which precipitation is snow (Celsius)

  • rain – Rainfall (mm/day)

  • bias – Average snow melting rate at 1 degree above ‘TmeltFreeze’ (mm/degreeCelsius/day)

  • ampl – Intra-annual amplitude snow melt at 1 degree > ‘TmeltFreeze’ (mm/degreeCelsius/day)

  • freq – Unit conversion time to annual cycle (radians/day)

  • doy – Day Of Year (1-366)

  • tmeltfreeze – Temperature above which snow melts (Celsius)

  • melt – Potential snow melt rate per degree above TmeltFreeze (mm/C/day)

  • swret – Liquid water storage capacity of snow (mm/mm/day)

  • swrf – Maximum refreezing rate per degree below ‘TmeltFreeze’ (mm/day/Celsius)

  • drystor – Snow amount as SWE (Soil Water Equivalent)

  • snowmelt – Snow melting (mm/day)

  • wetstor – Liquid water in snow (mm)

  • refreeze – Freezing of liquid water stored in snow (mm/day)

  • pwater – Potential water available from rain (mm/day)

  • wavail – Liquid water from rain, snow melt and storage in snow (mm/day)

  • sdepth – Snow depth (m)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • rhopack – Relative packing rate of snow (-/day)

  • lai – Leaf Area Index (m2 leaf / m2)

  • fdepth – Soil frost layer depth (m)

  • poolinfillimit – Soil frost depth limit for water infiltration (m)

  • pinfil – Infil of Pool (Wsupply - RNINTC) (mm/day)

  • wpoolmax – Maximum pool water (liquid plus ice) (mm)

  • wapl – Pool water amount, liquid (mm)

  • waps – Pool water amount, solid (=ice) (mm)

  • runon – Water in excess of what can infiltrate the soil (mm/day)

  • poolvolremain – Unused capacity of surface pool (mm/day)

  • poolinfil – Water flow to pool from other sources than ice thawing (mm/day)

  • frate – Rate of increase of frost layer depth (m/day)

  • tsurf – Soil surface temperature (C)

  • lambdaice – Thermal conductivity of ice (J/m/K/day)

  • rhowater – Density of water (kg/m3)

  • latentheat – Latent heat of water fusion (J/kg)

  • eta – Compound parameter (= LAMBDAice/(RHOwater*LatentHeat)) (m2/K/day)

  • freezepl – Freezing rate of pool water (mm/day)

  • infil – Water flow into soil from precipitation and snow melt (mm/day)

  • packmelt – Loss of snow height by packing and by melting (m/day)

  • pooldrain – Water flow from pool to soil (mm/day)

  • thawps – Rate of surface ice thawing (mm/day)

  • wremain – Liquid water staying in snow pack (mm/day)

Result pwater

Potential water available from rain (mm/day)

Result psnow

Potential snow available from rain (mm/day)

Result snowmelt

Snow melting (mm/day)

Result wmaxstore

Liquid water storage capacity of the snowpack (mm/day)

Result refreeze

Freezing of liquid water stored in snow (mm/day)

Result staywet

Liquid water in snow remaining liquid (mm/day)

Result wavail

Liquid water from rain, snow melt and storage in snow (mm/day)

Result wremain

Liquid water staying in snow pack (mm/day)

Result wsupply

Liquid water not staying in snow pack (mm/day)

Result density

Density of snow (m3/kg)

Result packmelt

Loss of snow height by packing and by melting (m/day)

Result rnintc

Interception of precipitation by the canopy (mm/day)

Result pinfil

Infil of Pool (Wsupply - RNINTC) (mm/day)

Result runon

Water in excess of what can infiltrate the soil (mm/day)

Result freezepl

Freezing rate of pool water (mm/day)

Result thawps

Rate of surface ice thawing (mm/day)

Result pooldrain

Water flow from pool to soil (mm/day)

lib_basgra.rootdg(fdepth, rootd, wal, rootdm, wcwp, rrdmax, delt, wcfc)¶

Root Depth “g?”

Parameters

  • fdepth – Soil frost layer depth (m)

  • rootd – Rooting depth (m)

  • wal – Soil water amount: liquid (mm)

  • rootd – Rooting depth (m)m Initial and maximum value rooting depth (m)

  • wcwp – Water concentration at wilting point (m3/m3)

  • rrdmax – Maximum root depth growth rate (m/day)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • wcfc – Water concentration at field capacity (m3/m3)

Result wcl

Water concentration in non-frozen soil (m3/m3)

Result rrootd

Root depth growth rate (m/day)

Result explor

Increased access to water by root depth growth (m/day)

lib_basgra.senescence(permgas, tanaer, delt, ldt50a, ldt50b, lt50, krdranaer, krsr3h, tsurf, dparam, lt50mx, tsurfdiff, ratedmx, resphard, clv, kresphard, lai, laicr, rdrsco, rdrsmx, rdrtmin, rdrtem, noharv, cstub, rdrstub, tilv, crt, rdroot)¶

Senescence Function

Parameters

  • permgas – Permeability of soil surface to gas exchange (-/day)

  • tanaer – Start anaerobic conditions (day)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • ldt50a – Intercept of linear dependence of LD50 on lT50 (day)

  • ldt50b – Slope of linear dependence of LD50 on LT50 (day/C)

  • lt50 – Sensitivity to Frost (Lethal Temperature 50%) Temperature that kills half the plants in a day (C)

  • krdranaer – Maximum relative death rate due to anearobic conditions (-/day)

  • krsr3h – Constant in the logistic curve for frost survival (-/C)

  • tsurf – Soil surface temperature (C)

  • dparam – Constant in the calculation of dehardening rate (-/C/day)

  • lt50mx – Maximum LT50 (C)

  • tsurfdiff – Soil surface temperature (C)

  • ratedmx – Maximum dehardening rate (C/day)

  • resphard – Plant hardening respiration (g C/m2/day)

  • clv – Carbon in leaves (g C/m2)

  • kresphard – Carbohydrate requirement of hardening (g C/ g C /C)

  • lai – Leaf Area Index (m2 leaf / m2)

  • laicr – LAI above which shading induces leaf senescence (m2 leaf / m2)

  • rdrsco – Relative death rate of leaves and non-elongating tillers due to shading when LAI is twice the threshold (LAICR) (-/day)

  • rdrsmx – Maximum relative death rate of leaves and non-elongating tillers due to shading (-/day)

  • rdrtmin – Minimum relative death rate of foliage (-/day)

  • rdrtem – Proportionality of leaf senescence with temperature (-/day/C)

  • noharv – Flag indicating that the current day is not a harvest day (-)

  • cstub – Carbon in stubble (g C/m2)

  • rdrstub – Relative death rate of stubble (-/day)

  • tilv – Non-elongating tiller density (-/m2)

  • crt – Carbon in roots (g C/m2)

  • rdroot – Relative death rate of roots (-/day)

Result dtanaer

Change in days since start anaerobic conditions (day/day)

Result hardrate

Hardening (LT50 becoming more negative) (C/day)

Result dehardrate

Dehardening rate (LT50 becoming less negative) (C/day)

Result tv2til

Relative death rate of non-elongating tillers (-/day)

Result dlai

Death rate of leaf area (m2 leaf /m2/day)

Result dlv

Death rate of leaf mass (g C/m2/day)

Result dstub

Death rate of stubble (g C/m2/day)

Result dtilv

Death rate of non-elongating tillers (tillers/m2/day)

Result drt

Death rate of roots (g C/m2/day)

lib_basgra.snowmeltwmaxstore(bias, ampl, freq, doy, davtmp, tmeltfreeze, drystor, delt, melt, swret)¶

Snow Melt Water Max Storage

  • bias – Average snow melting rate at 1 degree above ‘TmeltFreeze’ (mm/degreeCelsius/day)

  • ampl – Intra-annual amplitude snow melt at 1 degree > ‘TmeltFreeze’ (mm/degreeCelsius/day)

  • freq – Unit conversion time to annual cycle (radians/day)

  • doy – Day Of Year (1-366)

  • davtmp – Daily average temperature (Celsius)

  • tmeltfreeze – Temperature above which snow melts (Celsius)

  • drystor – Snow amount as SWE (Soil Water Equivalent)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • melt – Potential snow melt rate per degree above TmeltFreeze (mm/C/day)

  • swret – Liquid water storage capacity of snow (mm/mm/day)

Result snowmelt

Snow melting (mm/day)

Result wmaxstore

Liquid water storage capacity of the snowpack (mm/day)

lib_basgra.surfacepool(wpoolmax, wapl, waps, runon, poolvolremain, poolinfil, delt, fdepth, poolinfillimit, frate, tsurf, lambdaice, rhowater, latentheat, eta)¶

Surface Pool

Parameters

  • wpoolmax – Maximum pool water (liquid plus ice) (mm)

  • wapl – Pool water amount, liquid (mm)

  • waps – Pool water amount, solid (=ice) (mm)

  • runon – Water in excess of what can infiltrate the soil (mm/day)

  • poolvolremain – Unused capacity of surface pool (mm/day)

  • poolinfil – Water flow to pool from other sources than ice thawing (mm/day)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • fdepth – Soil frost layer depth (m)

  • poolinfillimit – Soil frost depth limit for water infiltration (m)

  • frate – Rate of increase of frost layer depth (m/day)

  • tsurf – Soil surface temperature (C)

  • lambdaice – Thermal conductivity of ice (J/m/K/day)

  • rhowater – Density of water (kg/m3)

  • latentheat – Latent heat of water fusion (J/kg)

  • eta – Compound parameter (= LAMBDAice/(RHOwater*LatentHeat)) (m2/K/day)

Result freezepl

Freezing of pool water (mm/day)

Result thawps

Rate of surface ice thawing (mm/day)

Result pooldrain

Water flow from pool to soil (mm/day)

lib_basgra.watersnow(bias, ampl, freq, doy, davtmp, tmeltfreeze, drystor, delt, melt, swret, swrf, wetstor, refreeze, pwater, wavail, sdepth, rhopack)¶

Water Snow

Parameters

  • bias – Average snow melting rate at 1 degree above ‘TmeltFreeze’ (mm/degreeCelsius/day)

  • ampl – Intra-annual amplitude snow melt at 1 degree > ‘TmeltFreeze’ (mm/degreeCelsius/day)

  • freq – Unit conversion time to annual cycle (radians/day)

  • doy – Day Of Year (1-366)

  • davtmp – Daily average temperature (Celsius)

  • tmeltfreeze – Temperature above which snow melts (Celsius)

  • drystor – Snow amount as SWE (Soil Water Equivalent)

  • delt – Model time step (day)

  • melt – Potential snow melt rate per degree above TmeltFreeze (mm/C/day)

  • swret – Liquid water storage capacity of snow (mm/mm/day)

  • swrf – Maximum refreezing rate per degree below ‘TmeltFreeze’ (mm/day/Celsius)

  • wetstor – Liquid water in snow (mm)

  • refreeze – Freezing of liquid water stored in snow (mm/day)

  • pwater – Potential water available from rain (mm/day)

  • wavail – Liquid water from rain, snow melt and storage in snow (mm/day)

  • sdepth – Snow depth (m)

  • rhopack – Relative packing rate of snow (-/day)

Result snowmelt

Snow melting (mm/day)

Result wmaxstore

Liquid water storage capacity of the snowpack (mm/day)

Result refreeze

Freezing of liquid water stored in snow (mm/day)

Result staywet

Liquid water in snow remaining liquid (mm/day)

Result wavail

Liquid water from rain, snow melt and storage in snow (mm/day)

Result wremain

Liquid water staying in snow pack (mm/day)

Result wsupply

Liquid water not staying in snow pack (mm/day)

Result density

Density of snow (m3/kg)

Result packmelt

Loss of snow height by packing and by melting (m/day)
